author: Special Correspondent
text:
Referring to the Peoples Democratic Party’s demand that Afzal Guru’s remains be buried in Kashmir, the Shiv Sena on Monday said the question raised by National Conference leader Omar Abdullah and AAP leaders — whether the Jammu and Kashmir chief ministerial designate Mehbooba Mufti will chant “Bharat Mata Ki Jai” — was legitimate.

“The BJP has never got along with Mehbooba Mufti. Her anti-national statements and her affinity with separatists was always a contentious issue. She was also openly sympathetic to Kashmiris who raised anti-India slogans. The BJP may be pleased that Mehbooba Mufti will become the Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister, but the country is worried,” an editorial in Shiv Sena mouthpiece Saamna said.

The editorial said in the context of the debate on nationalism, the questions raised by Mufti’s rival Mr. Abdullah, and some AAP leaders from Delhi whether she will chant “Bharat Mata Ki Jai” has made the BJP uncomfortable.

Whether Mehbooba Mufti will chant Bharat Mata Ki Jai is a valid question, says Saamna
title: Sena questions PDP-BJP marriage
